intro: Ibidium quinquelobatum, commonly known as the five-lobed ibidium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-lobed flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in riverine forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
